name: in a tizzy
notes:
in a tizzy is a fun and unique new way to use yarn cakes. you'll be making four triangle and joining them as you go to make a square. trust me, you'll love it!

this project was initially held as a cal in may 2022. it remains completely free on my blog and on youtube, or you can get the premium paid pdf here and on etsy.

[please read the introductory blog post about the cal here.][1]

[also available on etsy.][2]

<hr>

**most important!
seriously. read this part.**
**this listing is for the premium pdf version of the pattern. you can get the text only version totally free on my blog or from the video tutorials on youtube - it's the same exact pattern, but if you buy the pdf you get a beautifully designed, printable, ad free pattern to add to your pattern binder all while supporting a small business.**

the pattern will be be released in 4 parts. when you purchase this premium pdf version you'll receive an email from ravelry each time the pattern is updated. again, see my introductory blog post for more details.

***details***
**crochet terminology:** blog & youtube in us; pdf in us & uk
**skill level:** intermediate, but plenty of resources are available to make this easy enough for a new crocheter
**stitches used:** chain, slip stitch, sc, standing sc, dc, front and back post extended double crochet, treble, join-as-you-go method
**sizes:** any size square
**hook size:** 5mm or whatever is appropriate for your chosen yarn
**gauge:** not important for this pattern
**additional materials:** yarn needle and scissors for weaving ends; blocking supplies
***yarn:*** sample uses lion brand mandala ombre, but nearly any yarn can be used.
